Body: I am currently using the javascript AWS Iot SDK. Adapting the example provided here
column9: I have been able to register with my thingShadow
column10: and I am trying to publish an update after registration. However
column12:
I get the following error message:

cannot publish to reserved topic '$aws/things/<thingName>/shadow/update'

I understand the '$' indicates that this is a reserved topic
column13: but Amazon's documentation (http://docs.aws.amazon.com/iot/latest/developerguide/topics.html) states that publish and subscribe operations are allowed for this reserved topic. If that is the case
column14:
I am not sure why my attempt to publish is resulting in an error. This snippet demonstrates how I attempt to publish in my connection callback:

shadows.register(<thingName>

Body: @Michael-sqlbot Haha, fair question. Yes, I am currently using a valid thingName and message in those strings.

At the risk of asking a ridiculous question, you're not literally using the characters `<thingName>` in the literal string you've shown at `shadows.publish('$aws/things/<thingName>/shadow/update', <message>);`... right?  There's an actual valid thing name here?
I see that you are using the thing shadow class of the SDK to publish on a reserved topic. By looking at the source code of the SDK
column9: I see that it is not possible to publish on a reserved topic using this type of client
column10:
since all operations on reserved topics are conducted by .register() and .update().

You can however publish on these reserved topics by using the device class.
